txt.en:
'With so many people evacuating the city, many homes have been left empty.

'Unfortunately, there are some honourless thieves about that have taken the empty homes as an opportunity... and there aren't enough guards to take care of it.

'Would you mind looking for some of these foul thieves and teaching them a lesson? And return any stolen goods they have on them while you're at it.'
'Okay, okay! Just take it and let me go!'
'I was going to put it back, I swear!'
Húrin, Warden of the Keys, seeks your help with some opportunistic thieves on the streets and alleys of Minas Tirith.
'What, no, I wasn't... oh, forget it.'
'Oh, um... these are mine. I was just... moving this stuff.'
'Get out of here! You have no authority here!'
'Though the future of our city may not look so bright, I will not see its dignity fall. Not before its walls do, at least...\n\n'Thank you.'
'Um... thank goodness you're here! Some shady character just ran off... after dropping this bag of goods! I think they went... that way?'
'Big mistake, friend. I advise you to walk away while you still can.'
'Oh... if you don't tell anyone I was here, I'll give you a take of the goods!'
'Oh! Why are you bothering with such petty crimes as this?\n\n'The enemies of men lurk ever closer!'
'These people are never coming back! What're they going to need their stuff for?'
'What do you want? Mind your business!'
'They weren't coming back for their property, anyway.'
Return the stolen goods retrieved from the thieves to Húrin.
'Don't you have more important things to be doing?'
'I deserve these! You won't stop me from taking what I deserve!'
'There weren't supposed to be any guards here!'
'Don't the Wardens have more important things to attend to?'
Look for suspicious characters throughout the city and confront them. They could be anywhere!
